definition: potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
pit/threshold/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing water/☵
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Things might get a little bumpy.
sentences.chinese: 前路可能有点坎坷不平。

sentences.english: Henderson's tenure as CEO was tumultuous from the start.
sentences.chinese: 韩德胜的CEO之路从一开始就是坎坷不平的。

sentences.english: They walk on the rugged country road.
sentences.chinese: 他们在坎坷不平的乡村小路上走着。

sentences.english: The road was deeply rutted and pooled with rain.
sentences.chinese: 道路坎坷不平，到处是坑坑洼洼的雨水。

sentences.english: The stream is beautiful because it is at the foot of the road is bumpy.
sentences.chinese: 溪流的秀美是因为它脚下的路坎坷不平。

sentences.english: His life lurches from one crisis to another.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活坎坷不平，充满危机。

sentences.english: Though the way ahead is beset with difficulties, the country must continue her forward advance.
sentences.chinese: 在坎坷不平的道路上，中国必将继续前进的脚步。

sentences.english: In these years, have a plenty of bitterness, have a plenty of rough.
sentences.chinese: 在这几年里，有的是辛酸，有的是坎坷不平。

definition: bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
lit. a path covered in brambles/a course of action beset by difficulties (idiom)
